title: ModSettings
description: Modifies the orginal Settings class provided by the user

upload_received_event_topic.title: Upload Received Event Topic
upload_received_event_topic.description: Name of the topic to publish event that inform about new file uploads.

upload_received_event_type.title: Upload Received Event Type
upload_received_event_type.description: The type to use for event that inform about new file uploads.

file_metadata_event_topic.title: File Metadata Event Topic
file_metadata_event_topic.description: Name of the topic to receive new or changed metadata on files that shall be registered for uploaded.

file_metadata_event_type.title: File Metadata Event Type
file_metadata_event_type.description: The type used for events to receive new or changed metadata on files that are expected to be uploaded.

upload_accepted_event_topic.title: Upload Accepted Event Topic
upload_accepted_event_topic.description: Name of the topic to receive event that indicate that an upload was by downstream services.

upload_accepted_event_type.title: Upload Accepted Event Type
upload_accepted_event_type.description: The type used for event that indicate that an upload was by downstream services.

service_instance_id.title: Service Instance Id
service_instance_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this instance across all instances of this service. A globally unique Kafka client ID will be created by concatenating the service_name and the service_instance_id.

kafka_servers.title: Kafka Servers
kafka_servers.description: A list of connection strings to connect to Kafka bootstrap servers.

s3_access_key_id.title: S3 Access Key Id
s3_access_key_id.description: Part of credentials for login into the S3 service. See: https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html

s3_secret_access_key.title: S3 Secret Access Key
s3_secret_access_key.description: Part of credentials for login into the S3 service. See: https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html

s3_session_token.title: S3 Session Token
s3_session_token.description: Part of credentials for login into the S3 service. See: https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html

aws_config_ini.title: Aws Config Ini
aws_config_ini.description: Path to a config file for specifying more advanced S3 parameters. This should follow the format described here: https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/configuration.html#using-a-configuration-file

db_connection_str.title: Db Connection Str
db_connection_str.description: MongoDB connection string. Might include credentials. For more information see: https://naiveskill.com/mongodb-connection-string/

db_name.title: Db Name
db_name.description: Name of the database located on the MongoDB server.

port.title: Port
port.description: Port to expose the server on the specified host

log_level.title: Log Level
log_level.description: Controls the verbosity of the log.

auto_reload.title: Auto Reload
auto_reload.description: A development feature. Set to `True` to automatically reload the server upon code changes

workers.title: Workers
workers.description: Number of workers processes to run.

api_root_path.title: Api Root Path
api_root_path.description: Root path at which the API is reachable. This is relative to the specified host and port.

openapi_url.title: Openapi Url
openapi_url.description: Path to get the openapi specification in JSON format. This is relative to the specified host and port.

docs_url.title: Docs Url
docs_url.description: Path to host the swagger documentation. This is relative to the specified host and port.

cors_allowed_origins.title: Cors Allowed Origins
cors_allowed_origins.description: A list of origins that should be permitted to make cross-origin requests. By default, cross-origin requests are not allowed. You can use ['*'] to allow any origin.

cors_allow_credentials.title: Cors Allow Credentials
cors_allow_credentials.description: Indicate that cookies should be supported for cross-origin requests. Defaults to False. Also, cors_allowed_origins cannot be set to ['*'] for credentials to be allowed. The origins must be explicitly specified.

cors_allowed_methods.title: Cors Allowed Methods
cors_allowed_methods.description: A list of HTTP methods that should be allowed for cross-origin requests. Defaults to ['GET']. You can use ['*'] to allow all standard methods.

cors_allowed_headers.title: Cors Allowed Headers
cors_allowed_headers.description: A list of HTTP request headers that should be supported for cross-origin requests. Defaults to []. You can use ['*'] to allow all headers. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Language and Content-Type headers are always allowed for CORS requests.
